Of course! Here are some funny examples of logical consequences that you could use with your child:

1. If your child refuses to eat their vegetables, they have to wear a broccoli hat for the rest of the day.

2. If your child makes a mess while playing, they have to clean it up using a toothbrush.

3. If your child refuses to go to bed on time, they have to wear pajamas to school the next day.

4. If your child refuses to brush their teeth, they have to give their stuffed animals a toothbrushing session.

5. If your child forgets to turn off the lights when they leave a room, they have to wear a lampshade on their head.

Remember, the goal of logical consequences is not to humiliate or embarrass your child, but rather to make a lighthearted and playful experience out of teaching them a lesson. Use your judgment to make sure the consequence is appropriate for your child's age and temperament.
